trait.name: Radiant Aversion
entries: Each time Abel takes radiant damage, they take an extra 10 radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Abel makes two Claw attacks. They can replace one attack with a Bite attack and one with a Vampiric Blast attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing
{@condition grappled|XPHB|Grappled} if target Large or smaller, (escape {@dc 13}), {@b Movement} not halved, {@b one} creature grappled at a time.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, one creature who is {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing + 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic

Target's HP max reduced by necr. dmg, Abel regains HP equal to necr. dmg. {@b Reduction} removed by end of long rest, {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar effect. {@b Target dies} if HP max goes to 0.

action.name: Vampiric Touch
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic
Skeletal hand clings to target. Target can't regain HP until start of A.'s next turn.

bonus.name: Confusing Shriek
entries: {@b Tell:} Abel transforms his head into a giant bat head and begins to inhale.

{@b Neutralization:} The players must break Abel's Concentration on the transformation as one would break Concentration on a spell. Alternatively, the players can use the spell Silence to ensure Abel cannot shriek or plug their ears to ensure they can't hear him.

{@b Resolution:} Abel lets out a loud shriek. All creatures in a 30ft radius who can hear him must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution Saving Throw or become {@condition Dazed|fleemortals} (can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action). If a creature fails the Saving Throw by 5 or more it also becomes {@condition Deafened|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Volley of Claws
entries: {@b Tell:} Abel speaks an incantation and a cloud of spectral hands with long claws appear in a 5ft cylinder around him.
{@b Neutralization:} The players must leave the area around Abel.
{@b Resolution:} The spectral hands lash out at anyone in range. Every creature within 10ft of Abel that is not behind total cover is targeted with a {@b Claw} attack.

bonus.name: Heat Metal
entries: {@b Tell:} Abel produces a small flame in his hand and holds a small iron peg into the fire. He then starts chanting and the monstrance begins to glow.

{@b Neutralization:} The players must break Abel's Concentration on the transformation as one would break Concentration on a spell. Alternatively, the players can drop the monstrance so when it gets heated up nobody takes the damage.

{@b Resolution:} Abel casts {@spell heat metal} on the monstrance. Every creature touching it takes 9 ({@dice 2d8}) fire dmg. Every creature taking the damage and holding the monstrance must either let go of the monstrance or make a {@dc 13} Constitution Saving Throw to hold onto it. On a success they can keep their hold on it but have disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Ability Checks until the start of A.'s next turn

legendary.name: Fluttering Dash
entries: Abel transforms into a half-shaped bat form and moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then he reverts to his regular form.

legendary.name: Grabbing a Quick Bite
entries: Abel makes a Claw attack against a target in range

legendary.name: Speedy Snatch
entries: Abel makes a Claw attack against a target in range

spellcasting.name: Charm {@recharge 5}
headerEntries: Abel casts {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}), and the duration is 24 hours. The Charmed target is a willing recipient of Abel's Bite, the damage of which doesn't end the spell. When the spell ends, the target is unaware it was Charmed by Abel.

spellcasting.name: Beguile
headerEntries: Abel casts {@spell Command|XPHB}, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}). Abel can't take this action again until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Abel can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weakness
entries: The vampire has these weaknesses:

items.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

items.name: Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

items.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: The vampire is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Sunlight
entries: The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If Abel fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: If Abel drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} outside his resting place, Abel uses Shape-Shift to become mist (no action required). If he can't use Shape-Shift, he is destroyed.

While he has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in mist form, he can't return to his vampire form, and he must reach his resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in his resting place, he returns to his vampire form and has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until he regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and he regains 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} after spending 1 hour there.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two Claw attacks and uses Bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 13}) from one of two claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or that has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveFail} 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage. The target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to that amount.

bonus.name: Shape-Shift
entries: If Abel isn't in sunlight or running water, he shape-shifts into a Tiny bat ({@variantrule Speed|XPHB} 5 ft., {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} 30 ft.) or a Medium cloud of mist ({@variantrule Speed|XPHB} 5 ft., {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} 20 ft. [hover]), or he returns to his vampire form. Anything he is wearing transforms with him.
While in bat form, Abel can't speak. His game statistics, other than his size and {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, are unchanged.

While in mist form, Abel can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. he is weightless and can enter an enemy's space and stop there. If air can pass through a space, the mist can do so, but it can't pass through liquid. It has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

legendary.name: Deathless Strike
entries: Abel moves up to half his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and he makes one Claw attack.

trait.name: Anfällig für Radiant Damage
entries: Jedes Mal, wenn Abel Radiant Damage nimmt, erleidet er zusätzlich 10 Radiant Damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Abel führt zwei Klauenangriffe aus. Er kann eine Attacke durch eine Biss-Attacke und eine durch eine Vampirischer-Strahl-Attacke ersetzen.

action.name: Klauen
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing
{@condition grappled|XPHB|Grappled} if target Large or smaller, (escape {@dc 13}), {@b Movement} not halved, {@b one} creature {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Biss
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, one creature who is {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing + 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic

Target's HP max reduced by necr. dmg, Abel regains HP equal to necr. dmg. {@b Reduction} removed by end of long rest, {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar effect. {@b Target dies} if HP max goes to 0.

action.name: Vampirischer Strahl
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic
Skeletal hand clings to target. Target can't regain HP until start of A.'s next turn.

bonus.name: Betäubender Schrei
entries: {@b Tell:} Abel verwandelt seinen Kopf in einen riesigen Fledermauskopf und beginnt zu inhalieren.

{@b Neutralisierung:} Die Spieler müssen Abels Konzentration auf die Verwandlung unterbrechen, wie man die Konzentration auf einen Zauberspruch unterbrechen würde. Alternativ können die Spieler den Zauber Silence verwenden, um sicherzustellen, dass Abel nicht schreien kann, oder sich die Ohren zuhalten, um sicherzustellen, dass sie ihn nicht hören können.

{@b Auflösung:} Abel stößt einen lauten Schrei aus. Alle Kreaturen in einem Umkreis von 30 Fuß, die ihn hören können, müssen einen {@dc 13} Wisdom Saving Throw bestehen oder sie werden {@condition dazed|fleemortals}. Wenn eine Kreatur den Rettungswurf um 5 oder mehr verfehlt, wird sie außerdem {@condition deafened|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Krallengewirr
entries: {@b Tell:} Abel spricht eine Beschwörungsformel und eine Wolke aus gespenstischen Händen mit langen Klauen erscheint in einem 5-Fuß-Radius um ihn herum.
{@b Neutralisierung:} Die Spieler müssen den Bereich um Abel verlassen.

{@b Auflösung:} Die gespenstischen Hände greifen jeden in Reichweite an. Alle Kreaturen im Umkreis von 10ft um Abel, die sich nicht in völliger Deckung befinden, werden Ziel eines {@b Krallen}-Angriffs.

bonus.name: Metall Erhitzen
entries: {@b Tell:} Abel erzeugt eine Flamme in seiner Hand und hält einen kleinen, eisernen Stift in das Feuer. Dann stimmt er einen rhythmischen Gesang an, und die Monstranz beginnt zu leuchten.

{@b Neutralisierung:} Die Spieler müssen Abels Konzentration auf die Verwandlung unterbrechen, so wie man die Konzentration auf einen Zauberspruch unterbrechen würde. Alternativ können die Spieler die Monstranz fallen lassen, sodass niemand den Schaden erleidet, wenn sie erhitzt wird.

{@b Auflösung:} Abel wirkt den Zauber {@spell heat metal} auf die Monstranz. Jede Kreatur, die sie berührt, erleidet 9 ({@dice 2d8}) Feuerschaden. Jede Kreatur, die diesen Schaden erleidet und die Monstranz hält, muss entweder die Monstranz loslassen oder einen {@dc 13} Constitution Saving Throw machen, um sie festzuhalten. Bei einem Erfolg können sie die Monstranz festhalten, haben aber bis zum Beginn von A.s nächster Runde einen Nachteil bei Angriffswürfen und Skill Checks.

legendary.name: Flatterhafter Sprint
entries: Abel verwandelt sich in eine riesige, missgestaltete Fledermaus und bewegt sich bis zu seinem Speed ohne Opportunity Attacks zu provozieren.

legendary.name: Ein schneller Happen
entries: Abel führt einen Biss-Angriff gegen ein Ziel in Reichweite aus

legendary.name: Schneller Griff
entries: Abel führt einen Klauen-Angriff gegen ein Ziel in Reichweite aus

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The wasp doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Sting (Dmg Rider)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage.

action.name: Sting (Condition Rider)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Sting (Damage & Condition Rider)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw with the DC being equal to 5 + Poinson Damage Taken or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw with a DC of 10 at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

A druid calls on animals of the hills and mountains to aid her cause
Aquatic animals swim alongside a druid exploring the sea
Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

monster.name: Poisonous Shambling Mound

trait.name: Poison Absorption
entries: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to Poison damage, it regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Poison damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling mound makes three Poisonous Tendril attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Engulf.

action.name: Poisonous Tendril
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the shambling mound pulls the target 5 feet straight toward itself.

action.name: Engulf
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 15}, one Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is pulled into the shambling mound's space and has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 14}). Until the grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Acid damage at the start of each of its turns. When the shambling mound moves, the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The shambling mound can have only one creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by this action at a time.

entries.name: Shambling Mound
entries: {@i Manifestation of Primeval Power}

Shambling mounds—also known as "shamblers"—embody the tenacity of the wilderness, seeking only to consume and grow. These masses of vegetation rise up to half again as tall as a human and possess thick limbs and a vague head. As they move through bogs and undergrowth, they ensnare creatures that come within reach. Shambling mounds bury those they catch within their own forms as compost.

Strange circumstances might give rise to shambling mounds, transforming vegetation into hulks with rudimentary cunning. Such conditions include strikes from magical lightning, nature defending itself, or druidic curses. Roll on or choose a result from the Shambling Mound Cultivation table to inspire a shambling mound's origins and features.

entries.caption: Shambling Mound Cultivation
rows: Covered in vibrant alien or Feywild blooms.
Hauling a rune-etched menhir in its torso.
Made up of knotty vines entangling skeletons.
The remains of an ancient tree or a treant.

legendaryHeader: Legendary Action Uses: 3. Immediately after another creature's turn, the Mound can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The Mound regains all expended uses at the start of each of their turns.

legendary.name: Shambling Escape
entries: The Mound retreats into the roots at the ceiling of the room, moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and reappears.

legendary.name: Poison Cloud (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mound emits a cloud of poison around it. Each creature within 10 feet of the Mound must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Corrosive Spit
entries: The Mound shoots out a stream of corrosive, foul smelling liquid, that targets one nonmagical metal object—armor or a weapon—worn or carried by a creature within 10 feet of itself. {@actSave dex} {@dc 13}, the creature with the object. {@actSaveFail} The object takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers (armor) or to its attack rolls (weapon). Armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10, and a weapon is destroyed if its penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the {@spell Mending|XPHB} spell on the armor or weapon

monster.name: Zombie Gnoll
languages: Abyssal and Gnoll but can't speak

trait.name: Rampaging Charge
entries: If the marauder moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and hits them with a Flail attack on the same turn, the marauder can make a Bite attack against that target as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie gnoll to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie gnoll drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 10}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Vile Bile
entries: The Zombie Gnoll hurls a vomit projectile at a target it can see within 60ft.
The target must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity Saving Throw, taking 5 ({@dice 2d4}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Shambling Gait
entries: The Zombie Gnoll moves up to half its speed, then it makes a bite attack against a target in range.

legendary.name: Bile Spray
entries: The Zombie Gnoll makes a Vile Bile attack.

item.name: Bloodfang (Legacy)
entries: This dagger's execeptionally long and slender blade is fashioned to look like a wicked, curved fang. It has no hilt and its grip is wrapped with shiny red leather straps, showing no sign of age or decay.

entries.name: Steel Bite
entries: This dagger has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dusk. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon and the creature is willing or has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, you can expend one of the dagger's charges to deal an additional {@dice 2d4} Necrotic damage to the creature.

The creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.
